thread.title: Roundup: Mount Everett girls roll to 4-0 win in soccer
thread.title_full: Roundup: Mount Everett girls roll to 4-0 win in soccer

author:
Berkshire Eagle Staff
sports@berkshireeagle.com @EagleSportsZone on Twitter
title: Roundup: Mount Everett girls roll to 4-0 win in soccer
text:
0 
First Half W—Own goal by Hoosac, 4:38. W—Kyle Lyman (Shane Sinopoli), 10:27. W—Own goal by Hoosac, 16:48. W—Lyman (UA), 17:48. W—Matt Schneider (Isaac Voltoline), 33:10. 
Second Half W—Lyman (UA), 61:16. W—Cole Accardi (Schneider) 65:11. Saves—W: Brayden Chevillet 2. H: John Horton 6. High School Golf 
MONUMENT MOUNTAIN 182, ST. JOSEPH 185 
At Pontoosuc Lake Country Club in Pittsfield, St. Joseph took the course needing two wins to qualify for the Western Massachusetts Division III tournament. Monument Mountain had other ideas. 
St. Joe's Cody Tynan was medalist with a 5-over-par 40, but the Crusaders couldn't overcome the Spartans. 
"Our top three were great. We needed one more score today," said St. Joe coach Fran Brilliant. "The back of [Monument]s rotation was pretty strong. It wasn't our day." 
Tynan beat Monument's Dylan Buffoni by one shot. ——— ST. JOSEPH (185) — Andy Cella 43, Brent Arseneau 58, Cody Tynan 40, Jacob Felix 62, Mike Gingras 44, Jett Werhan 60. MONUMENT (182) — Aaron Coons 49, Dylan Buffoni 41, Lexi Shumsky 48, Max Joyner 51, Matt Iemolini 45, Dylan Tinker 48. Birdies: Tynan (No. 4). College men's soccer 
MT. ST. VINCENT 3, MCLA 2 
In North Adams, the MCLA men's soccer team fell in heartbreaking fashion to Mt. St. Vincent on Monday, losing 3-2 on a goal that was scored with under a minute remaining in regulation. 
The Trailblazers (2-7-2) had to battle out of a 2-0 hole to even get to that point. Mt. St. Vincent scored 1:14 into the game on a Joseph Llamuca goal, then Kevin Jardines put the Dolphins up 2-0 in the 18th minute. 
Before the half was out, though, Anthony Basile scored a header on a pass from Tyler Vona and Dylan Pereira, and Christopher Valente tied things up off of a Sakan Sadowsky cross. 
In goal for MCLA, Kamron Anderson stopped six shots in the loss. Prep schools 
MISS HALL'S 5, WESTOVER 2 
Sally Nason of Lee scored three goals for Miss Hall's in a big win over Westover. 
The Hurricanes are now 4-2-1.
